实战教程：开发 CRUD 功能

Tagtag Starter is a general-purpose, modular admin backend framework built with Java and Spring Boot 3. It aims to provide a lightweight and solid foundation for building business applications, helping developers quickly build high-quality admin management systems.
Tagtag Starter has a clear positioning:
The best starting scaffold for new projects
. We don't aim for complex, all-encompassing features, but focus on providing a
development foundation, allowing developers to focus on implementing business logic rather than fighting with configuration files.
: The system is split into multiple clearly defined modules (
, etc.), ensuring clear structure and easy maintenance and extension. Just like LEGO blocks, build whatever you want.
: API definitions are separated from implementations using
modules, standardizing the code structure and facilitating frontend-backend collaboration and interface management. No more arguments between frontend and backend about interface definitions.
: Built-in RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) permission management system, supporting menu permissions, button permissions, and data permissions. Who should see what and do what is crystal clear.

: Built-in operation logs, API rate limiting, dictionary management, file storage, and other core features to meet the needs of most admin systems. Ready to use out of the box, no need to reinvent the wheel.
: Backend built on Spring Boot 3, MyBatis Plus, and Redis; frontend built on Vue 3 + TypeScript + Vite, adopting the Vben Admin 5 framework. Use the latest technology to write the most elegant code.

: Modular design allows adding new business functions by simply creating a new Maven module, without polluting existing core code. Add whatever features you need without worrying about breaking the core.
Among the myriad of admin frameworks, Tagtag has the following unique advantages:

: No burden of complex microservice architectures, no hard-to-understand abstraction layers. Tagtag keeps the code pure and intuitive, allowing you to run the project in minutes, not days. After all, our goal is to write business code, not study framework source code.

: When you need to start a new admin project, Tagtag offers the purest starting point. It doesn't come pre-loaded with tons of redundant code, letting you travel light and focus on implementing business logic. Just like buying a new car, you don't need to remove a bunch of useless accessories first.

: Provides complete, clear documentation to help developers quickly get started and deeply understand the framework. We believe good documentation is more important than good code (of course, our code is also pretty good).

: We only include the essential features that almost every admin system requires—User Management, Role/Permission Configuration, Menu Management, Operation Logs, API Rate Limiting, Dictionary Management, and File Storage. Not too much, not too little, just right.

: No pre-installed pile of middleware and third-party libraries that you might never use. Keeping the codebase light means lower maintenance costs and reduced risk of dependency conflicts. After all, who wants to crash the entire project because of an uncommon dependency.
: You can easily extend new feature modules according to project requirements. Just like ordering takeout, add whatever you want, no forced consumption.

: Based on the standard Spring Boot structure combined with modular design, the code logic is clear at a glance. Even junior developers can quickly understand and start developing, making it easy for teams to customize. No need to study code like reading a mysterious book.

: Built-in unified response encapsulation, exception handling, and logging standards establish a standardized development template for team collaboration. Team members no longer need to argue endlessly about code style.
: Follows strict code standards, with clear code structure and comprehensive comments, facilitating maintenance and extension. We believe good code speaks for itself.
: Built on Spring Boot 3 + JDK 17, integrating MyBatis Plus, Redis, Spring Security, JWT, and other mainstream technologies. Use the latest technology to write the most stable code.

: Built on Vue 3 + TypeScript + Vite, adopting the Vben Admin 5 framework, using Tailwind CSS and Shadcn UI for interface development. Beautiful interface, smooth interaction, first-class user experience.
: We continuously follow and adopt the latest tech stack to ensure the framework remains modern. After all, technology develops so fast, we can't fall behind.

: Thanks to the clear module division, adding new business functions only requires creating a new Maven module without polluting existing core code. Just like building blocks, add whatever features you want.

: Modules have distinct responsibilities and low coupling. Whether integrating new third-party services or splitting existing business logic, the modular design makes extension effortless. No need to affect the whole system for one change.

: Modules communicate through the contract layer, reducing dependencies between modules and improving the system's flexibility and maintainability. Modify one module without worrying about breaking others.
Tagtag is suitable for the following types of projects:
: Such as CRM, ERP, OA, and other enterprise internal management systems. Make enterprise operations more efficient and make employees' work easier.
: Suitable for building multi-tenant SaaS platform admin systems. One system serves multiple customers, saving money and worry.
: Suitable for building e-commerce platform admin systems. Product management, order processing, data analysis, all in one place.
: Suitable for building various content management systems. Articles, images, videos, manage whatever you want.
: Suitable for building API management and monitoring platforms. API documentation, API testing, API monitoring, all in one stop.
: Suitable for building various types of admin management systems. As long as it's an admin management system, Tagtag can handle it.
Tagtag is not suitable for the following types of projects:
: Such as social networks, live streaming platforms, etc. For projects of this level, use a professional distributed architecture.
: If your project requires a complex microservice architecture, Tagtag may not be the best choice. We focus on monolithic applications, simplicity is beauty.
: If you need highly customized UI design, you may need to make significant modifications to the frontend code. However, our UI is already beautiful, you probably don't need customization at all.

, you can run through the entire project in minutes. Trust me, it's faster than cooking a bowl of instant noodles.

Tagtag adopts a frontend-backend separation architecture design, with the backend built on Java and Spring Boot 3, and the frontend built on Vue 3 + TypeScript + Vite. To learn more about Tagtag's architecture design, please check our
. Our architecture design is as clear as building blocks, guaranteeing you'll understand it after reading.

Tagtag is an open-source project, and we welcome community contributions and feedback. If you have any questions or suggestions, please submit an Issue or Pull Request on GitHub. We promise to treat every Issue seriously and carefully review every PR.

Thank you for your interest and support of Tagtag Starter! We believe that Tagtag Starter will become your powerful assistant in building admin management systems. Choosing Tagtag Starter means choosing a simple, efficient, and elegant development experience. Let's achieve maximum value with minimal code together.
Tagtag Admin Framework - A lightweight, modular admin backend framework built with Java and Spring Boot 3.
Get up and running with Tagtag in minutes.
